item.title: ELK for beginner
item.description: Why we use ELK? The Elastic Stack (aka ELK) is a robust solution for search, log management, and data analysis. ELK consists of a combination of three open source project: Elasticsearch, Logstash, and Kibana. These projects have specific roles in ELK: Elasticsearch handles storage and provides a RESTful search and analytics endpoint. Logstash is a server-side data processing pipeline that ingests, transforms and loads data. Kibana lets you visualize your Elasticsearch data and navigate the Elastic Stack.
